positive.title: First Mover Asia: First $30K, Then $40K, but Bitcoin Needs Volatility First
positive.description: The world’s largest digital asset is rangebound, but so far this year, bitcoin is beating the returns most digital asset funds are posting.

positive.title: Crypto News Today: Bitcoin's Rally Toward $30K, PayPal's Stablecoin Fakes, and More
positive.description: As Bitcoin retakes $30K and major players like PayPal delve into the crypto realm, the intersection of traditional finance and crypto becomes more pronounced.

positive.title: Fed Starts New Program to Oversee Crypto Activity in U.S. Banks
positive.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is starting a new program for overseeing banks’ crypto activity, and it further clarified its requirement that the lenders under its authority get approval before engaging in digital assets activities.

positive.title: BlackRock insiders say Bitcoin ETF is likely 6 months away: Novogratz
positive.description: “We’re going to fight like cats and dogs to win market share” once spot Bitcoin ETFs are approved, Galaxy Digital CEO Mike Novogratz told shareholders.

positive.title: US Fed steps up oversight of banks' involvement with crypto firms
positive.description: The limitations set out in the Federal Reserve’s new Program provides additional measures to its original policy statement laid out in January.

positive.title: ChatGPT and Claude are ‘becoming capable of tackling real-world missions,’ say scientists
positive.description: The scientists developed a tool called "AgentBench" to benchmark LLM models as agents.

positive.title: How self-sovereign identity helps users own their data
positive.description: Shiba Inu lead developer Shytoshi Kusama recently unveiled plans to integrate self-sovereign identity into its projects.

positive.title: First Mover Asia: SEC Appealing XRP Ruling Isn't Moving Markets
positive.description: Ripple's partial victory over the Securities and Exchange Commission pushed up the layer 1 and altcoin market, as many of these tokens had been accused of being securities.

positive.title: Animated Series Futurama Takes Characters to 'Doge City,' Mocks Crypto Miners
positive.description: Popular animated science fiction show Futurama gave a glimpse into what it thinks the future of crypto could look like in its latest episode called “How the West Was 101001” by mocking crypto miners.

positive.title: Barbie Is a Metaverse
positive.description: Virtual worlds, like Barbie’s, are a source of meaning and fulfillment for people seeking more in life. And these worlds gain from interactions: the more interoperability, the better.

positive.title: Aptos token rises 11.6% after Microsoft deal to marry AI with blockchain
positive.description: APT pumped 17.6% within the first 50 minutes before cooling off to $7.51 — still 11.6% above pre-announcement levels.

positive.title: Fireblocks discloses massive vulnerability affecting crypto wallets
positive.description: Fireblocks said the vulnerabilities affecting Coinbase, Binance, and Zengo have since been fixed and has reached out to more than 12 others still at risk.

positive.title: Bitcoin Lightning Network is growing, but 3 major challenges remain
positive.description: The Lightning Network is growing, but liquidity issues and a need for greater user awareness continue to hinder mainstream adoption.

negative.title: PayPal stablecoin launch sparks wave of fake PYUSD tokens
negative.description: Nearly 30 fake PYUSD tokens cropped up in the wake of PayPal’s most recent announcement.

negative.title: Coinbase Exec: ‘There’s No Playbook’ for Public Company Launching Blockchain
negative.description: As Coinbase, the big U.S. crypto exchange, plans to launch its new Base blockchain on Wednesday, CoinDesk interviewed Jesse Pollak, who’s leading the effort. Here’s an excerpted version.

negative.title: Venture-Backed Saddle Finance Proposes Wind-Down, Dissolution
negative.description: The Ethereum-based crypto trading protocol will shut down and distribute its treasury to investors.

negative.title: Desperately Seeking Crypto’s Killer App
negative.description: When you take away the speculation, what Web3 services actually deliver utility for users?

negative.title: Core Scientific’s bankruptcy plan includes equity stake for Bitmain and Anchorage
negative.description: If the plan is approved, Core Scientific could buy 27,000 Bitmain miners for roughly $23 million in cash and $54 million in company equity.

negative.title: Bitstamp to suspend trading of major altcoins for US users
negative.description: All the soon-to-be-suspended tokens are alleged by the SEC to be securities in its lawsuit against Coinbase and Binance.

negative.title: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame and US prosecutors are discussing a plea deal: Report
negative.description: It’s unclear whether any reported guilty plea from Ryan Salame would have the former FTX Digital Markets co-CEO testify at Sam Bankman-Fried's trial in October.

negative.title: The Protocol: Coinbase Launches Own Blockchain as Sleuths Scour PayPal's Stablecoin Software
negative.description: In this week's issue, we cover Coinbase's launch of "Base," a layer-2 network atop Ethereum, along with the crypto community's reaction to PayPal's new stablecoin and the brouhaha over Matter Labs' use of Polygon-crafted open-source software. The Protocol is CoinDesk's weekly newsletter devoted to blockchain and crypto technology.

negative.title: SEC Will Appeal XRP Ruling in Case Against Ripple, Regulator Says
negative.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said it would file an "interlocutory appeal" of a judge's ruling on Ripple's programmatic sales of XRP, the regulator said in a court filing Wednesday.

negative.title: Fireblocks Discloses ‘Zero Day’ Vulnerabilities Impacting Leading MPC Wallets
negative.description: It’s unlikely users were impacted by the vulnerabilities – collectively referred to as “BitForge” – but Fireblocks says they could’ve let hackers “drain funds from the wallets of millions of retail and institutional customers in seconds” if left unfixed.

negative.title: Bitcoin miner Riot Platforms trims Q2 loss to $27.7M
negative.description: The firm managed to narrow net loss in the quarter as it ramped up Bitcoin production.

negative.title: SEC to seek interlocutory appeal in Ripple case
negative.description: The SEC's interlocutory appeal comes nearly a month after Judge Analisa Torres laid out her non-final ruling.

negative.title: Base network has officially launched: Here's how it can be used
negative.description: Coinbase’s Base network completed its phased launch on Aug. 9 and is officially open to end-users.

negative.title: Bitcoin risks 15% dip by October, but $100K is due in 2026 — Analysis
negative.description: Bitcoin falling back to $25,000 would mark its “last big dip” before the next BTC price bull run, says Cane Island’s Timothy Peterson.

negative.title: Blockchain games aren’t really decentralized… but that’s about to change
negative.description: A ragtag group of communists and ZK-rollup fans are working tirelessly to make blockchain games composable and fully on-chain. It’s not easy.

negative.title: China’s risky Bitcoin court decision, is Huobi in trouble or not? Asia Express
negative.description: Man loses $10M after Chinese court rules Bitcoin lending is not protected by law, loads of Web3 founders get arrested, and Huobi rumors swirl.
